data.title: Francesco Totti vs Alessandro Del Piero
data.meta_description: ...............  Oh dear, this one is hard for us neutrals...

Re: Francesco Totti vs Alessandro Del Piero

Oh dear, this one is hard for us neutrals...

Re: Francesco Totti vs Alessandro Del Piero

by Busby Babe Thu Jun 30, 2011 3:31 pm

Del Piero.

I firmly believe if it wasn't for that injury, more people would mention him under the same breath as Zidane and Ronaldo.

Re: Francesco Totti vs Alessandro Del Piero

by :{Mr.Mustachio! Thu Jun 30, 2011 4:02 pm

ronaldo__9 wrote:Del Piero.

I firmly believe if it wasn't for that injury, more people would mention him under the same breath as Zidane and Ronaldo.

They probably should anyway, but your right, in that eventuality they'd be forced too.

Re: Francesco Totti vs Alessandro Del Piero

by Guest Fri Jul 01, 2011 2:06 am

Del Piero, in my opinion, is better on and off the pitch. Both men are great, but Del Piero can simply not be compared to. I know I may be biased, but I seriously can say I have not met a person, regardless of their preference to team, who dislikes him for his skill and his respect.

He's gotten standing ovations from Manchester United's crowd, Real Madrid's crowd, even Inter's crowd. He is a phenomenon and a champion that will forever not be forgotten. He is the ultimate footballer.

STATS:

Del Piero has scored 276 in 612, a goal every 2.21 games. Totti has scored 245 in 574, scoring a goal every 2.34 games. Del Piero has scored 53 goals in European Competitions, Totti has 35. Totti has 9 in 58 for Italy, a goal every 9.83 games. Del Piero has 27 goals in 91 for Italy, a goal every 3.37 games

The stats says it all. Forget about the stuff above, in terms of loyalty, class and magic- theyre unbeatable. Forget trophies, accolades etc. These two are sublime!! When it comes down to FT vs ADP, it's all about whoever inspires you, whoever dazzles you. And for me, watching Del Piero so many times, its obviously him.

However, apart from my personal bias I cannot separate these two legends whose loyalty, passion and consummate skill and creativity is unquestionalbe. Each has in their own way contributed immensely to Italian football, with youngsters around the world aspiring to be just these two players and when it comes to the time when they hang-up their boots they will both be remembered as Legends.'

Re: Francesco Totti vs Alessandro Del Piero

by Superpeppe Thu Jul 07, 2011 7:57 pm

Del piero has more class.

Re: Francesco Totti vs Alessandro Del Piero

by Lord Spencer Thu Jul 07, 2011 10:47 pm

Very difficult choice to make, both are icons, they define the word. Juve fans and Rome fans had their favorite players, FT and ADP are more than favorite player, they represent the club, and represent the game.

I would like to also to point the fact that both players have an excellent adaptation skill. Both changed their playing style to accomedate their age, body, and the ever changing game.

Salute to them both.

Scicca said it all by the way, and he is right.

by billy_gr Fri Jul 08, 2011 2:42 pm

Totti for me. On club level Del Piero had always better teammates around him.

On the other hand I do believe that if it wasn’t for the injury ADP would have been one of the greatest

Still they were both amazing players

Re: Francesco Totti vs Alessandro Del Piero

by hrealmadrid Fri Jul 08, 2011 3:42 pm

Dang, 50/50. I have to go with Totti because of his contributions to the national team.

by the xcx Fri Jul 08, 2011 4:35 pm

Totti because hes a gladiator

by The Nature Boy Sat Jul 09, 2011 12:26 am

Francesco Totti is a lowlife degenerate, and an inferior footballer to Alessandro Del Piero, who, outside of Maldini, is probably the classiest italian to ever play the game.

Forza Del Piero per sempre e basta

Re: Francesco Totti vs Alessandro Del Piero

by ErPupone Sat Jul 09, 2011 4:27 pm

king_alex10 wrote:Francesco Totti is a lowlife degenerate, and an inferior footballer to Alessandro Del Piero, who, outside of Maldini, is probably the classiest italian to ever play the game.

Forza Del Piero per sempre e basta

Your level of intelligence is quite outstanding... muppet.

And speaking of injuries (directed to those who actually took the time to write a mature comment, unlike some idiots)...

Though he bounced back from that injury in 2006, it has shown it's effect again especially since he picked up a few more injuries since then on that leg. If it weren't for that, he would be way past his 207 goals (which is a record for most goals in one jersey).

Now I'm not going to be a classless jerk and say Totti is better simply because I'm a Roma fan. There is very little to seperate both these legends and even statistics can't do it. I'm just happy that I've had the chance to see them both play and win the World Cup together (today is the 5 year anniversary of that btw) as no one will ever be able to repeat their endeavours for their respective clubs.
